body:
### Problem

define a buffer keymap callback for rust filetype . in callback do treesitter highlights query type match . then open a rust file do lhs . crashed.

### Steps to reproduce

min config 

```lua
vim.opt.runtimepath:append("path/to/nvim-treesitter")
require('nvim-treesitter').setup({})

vim.opt.termguicolors = true

local api =vim.api
local buf = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
local function ts_node_match(target,  opt)
  local row, col = unpack(vim.api.nvim_win_get_cursor(0))
  local line = vim.api.nvim_buf_get_lines(opt.buf, row - 1, row, false)[1]
  local word = string.match(line:sub(1, col), '%w+$') or ''
  local ok, lang = pcall(vim.treesitter.language.get_lang, vim.bo[opt.buf].filetype)
  if not ok or not lang then
    return
  end
  local has, parser = pcall(vim.treesitter.get_parser,opt.buf, lang)
  if not parser or not has then
    return false
  end
  local query = vim.treesitter.query.get(lang, 'highlights')
  if not query then
    return
  end
  local curnode = vim.treesitter.get_node({ bufnr = opt.buf })
  if not curnode then
    return
  end
  local root = curnode:tree()
  return true
end

  api.nvim_buf_set_keymap(buf, 'i', ';', '', {
    noremap = true,
    nowait = true,
    expr = true,
    callback = function()
      local opt = {
        buf = buf,
      }
      opt.lnum, opt.col = unpack(api.nvim_win_get_cursor(0))
      if ts_node_match('namespace', opt) then
        return '::'
      end
      return ';'
    end,
  })

```

nvim --clean -u `min.lua` src/main.rs. in this file 

```rust
#[derive(Debug)]
enum PokerSuit {
    Clubs,
}

pub fn enum_in_rust() {
    let clubs = PokerSuit::Clubs;
    if clubs == PokerSuit|->cursor here
}
```
hold `;` until crash..


### ScreenShot

![test](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/41671631/bbebeda1-3f4a-483c-9372-376b22ab0f78)


### Crash Report


### Expected behavior

not crash

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0-dev-326+g108601647  

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

macos 13.1

### Terminal name/version

kitty

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty

### Installation

build frome source

comment_data.body: Can you reproduce this with another parser?
nope. these code snippets  from my plugin that just write for rust (currently) . so I didn't test with other prsers .
Please test it; the code snippet should be language-agnostic (just pick another node type).

I can reproduce it with the bundled Lua parser (just use `variable` instead of `namespace`). Would be helpful to narrow it down more.

Note that you need to _hold_ `;` to trigger the crash, so this looks to be a race condition.
try some tests . bug crash from  `TSnode:tree()` .updated reproduce min code.

work around fix. 

```lua
  local first = vim.treesitter.get_node({ bufnr = opt.buf, pos = { 0, 0 } })
  if not first then
    return
  end
  local root = first:parent()
  if not root then
    return
  end

  for id, node, _ in query:iter_captures(root, opt.buf, 0, opt.lnum) do
       xxxxxxxxxxx
  end

```

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

title: treesitter  api caused neovim crash
